result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua John Jergenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua John Jergenson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua John Jergenson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1, 2, 4 and 5.
Concurrent to Count 1 in 13CF287.
Defendant to report to Probation today January 9, 2015.
Bond continues until Defendant is signed up for Probation.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Jonathan Bradley Lundeen, DF:  Joshua John Jergenson appeared. Includes 13CF287, 13CM194, 13CM259, 13TR4453, 14CF64, 14CF377. Atty's recite agreement. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charges and possible penalties for ct 3 in 14CF377 - Def pleads guilty. 
Court reads charge and possible penalties for ct 1 in 13CM194 - Def pleads guilty. 
Court reads charges and possible penalties for ct 1 and ct 2 (OWI 2nd) in 13CF287. Def pleads guilty. 
Court uses complaints/reports as factual basis, accepts pleas and adjudicates def guilty of ct 3 in 14CF377; ct 1 in 13CM194; cts 1 & 2 (OWI 2nd) in 13CF287.
Court dismisses counts 1, 2, 4 and 5 in 14CF377; count 2 in 13CM194; counts 3, 4 and 5 in 13CF287. Court dismisses 13CM259, 13TR4453 and 14CF64. 

Court orders in 13CF287 and 14CF377 - S/W 2 years probation with conditions: (Count 1 in 13CF287 and count 3 in 14CF377 concurrent)
- Court costs for count 1, $268.00 
- Absolute sobriety 
- No abusive contact with Jennifer W. 
Def to sign up for probation today. Bail continues until signed up. 

Count 2 (OWI 2nd): 
- 15 days in St. Croix County Jail with credit for 5 days time served and good time. May serve on 2 consecutive weekends. Defendant to report 2/20/15 by 7:00 pm and released on 2/23/14 by 8:00 am. Must return 2/27/15 by 7:00 pm and released on 3/2/15 by 8:00 am
- $1109 fine
- 12 month license revocation with credit for administrative suspension
- 12 month ignition interlock device
- AODA and follow all recommendations

13CM194: 
- Court costs $243.00
- 15 days in St. Croix County concurrent to OWI 2nd in 14CF287.  
Defendant is advised on right to appeal. 
Apply money on file to fines and payment plan to continue until final atty invoice is filed.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb.  ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Joseph Caton DF:  Joshua John Jergenson appeared.  Court called at 2:03 p.m.  DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver. Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause and binds the DE over for trial.  Court proceeds to arraignment.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads N/G to all counts.  Attorney Caton asks to amend the bond to a signature.  Court amends the bond from $1000 to $500 cash bond.  Court sets for PTC with EJL.  Court adjourned at 2:18 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 24, 2014 at 09:00 am.

- Pay bond by 09/12/14 by 12:00 p.m. or report to jail by 1:00 p.m.

 -It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Jennifer W.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
  
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
